skillTree.localised_description: The Agents of the Fellowhip of the Shroud wield silvered blades blessed by the priests of Morr to aid them in their fight against the Undead.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 15% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: The Priests of Morr inspires their allies to understand the pitiable state of the Undead and invoke Morr's outrage at their presence.

effects.description:
Attrition: -50% casualties suffered from Vampiric territory attrition
	(all units in army)
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description:
Leadership: +4 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Dark rippling flames pour forth from the caster, smiting the Undead.

effects.description:
Hero capacity: -2 for Vampires
	(local enemy province)

skillTree.localised_description: The caster chants a solemn prayer over the corpse, ensuring the soul is sent to Morr's realm and making it immune to necromancy.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

attributes.bullet_text:
Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

effects.description:
Raise dead cost: +100%
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: A calming prayer that causes enemies to slumber like the dead.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: -10%
	(enemy armies in local province)

Enemy leadership: -6
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: A drawn blade should not be put away until slaked in blood.
This being fights dirty, no honour system applies here!
"Stay in one place, gods-damn you!"
Full-plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
"I spy with my beady eye… something that needs to be killed."
Always on the lookout for an opening or advantage in battle - somewhere to put the knife in…
The harder they hit, the more they commit, the easier it is to strike back.
"The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."
Never trap this one, when cornered they have nothing left to lose.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Spirit Leech"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Spirit Leech Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Spirit Leech Upgraded"

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

effects.description: Overcast spell: "Aspect of the Dread Knight Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: "I am not here to inspire, I am here to kill - come let us draw blades together!"

effects.description: Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 3%
Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 8%
Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: Such magic-users may be wise and able to offer sage advice, especially if they have scried the region.

effects.description: Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 2%
Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 4%
Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 6%

skillTree.localised_description: Oft-times, though you may have much, what you want the most is what your rivals have; such envy focuses the mind and creativity.

effects.description: Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 3%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 6%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 10%

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: "I'm no pupil, but an adept! A hex on them, may their souls shrivel from their bones!"

effects.description: Assault Unit action: Additional 5% damage caused
Assault Unit action: Additional 15% damage caused
Assault Unit action: Additional 30% damage caused

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
Entities with this attribute ignore the effects of enemy contact effects such as  Poison

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead
